algorithm_technique: Use a sliding window approach with a frequency map to count subarrays containing all distinct elements of the original array.
problem_summary_simple: Count subarrays that contain all unique numbers present in the entire array.
problem_summary_technical: Employ a sliding window and frequency map to find subarrays whose distinct element count matches the total distinct elements in the array.
key_insights: First, determine the total number of distinct elements in the entire array.
Use a sliding window (left and right pointers) and a frequency map to track elements within the current window.
When the window contains all distinct elements, all subarrays starting from `left` up to the current `right` are complete.
